Lesser, inferior, weaker. Neuter of comparative of heka used for that of kakos; worse; by implication, less.

16.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
16.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
16.str2: To burden, oppress, weigh down. From kata and bareo; to impose upon.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Cunning, crafty, skilful, clever. From pas and ergon; all-working, i.e. Adroit.

16.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
16.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
16.str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
16.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Deceit, guile, treachery. From an obsolete primary verb, dello; a trick, i.e. wile.

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
17.str2: To take advantage of, overreach, defraud. From pleonektes; to be covetous, i.e. to over-reach.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

17.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
17.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

17.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
17.str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
17.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
18.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
18.str2: To send together with. From sun and apostello; to despatch in company with.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: To take advantage of, overreach, defraud. From pleonektes; to be covetous, i.e. to over-reach.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
18.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If not, unless, whether at all. From me and the neuter of tis; whether at all.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
18.str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A track, footstep. From ikneomai; a track.

19.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
Of old, long ago, in times past, former. Probably another form for palin; formerly, or sometime since; ancient.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

19.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
19.str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

19.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
19.str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Opposite, in front (of), over against. From kata and enanti; directly opposite.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
Feminine of a compound of oikos and the base of doma; architecture, i.e. a structure; figuratively, confirmation.

20.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
20.str2: To come, go.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
20.str2: Probably akin to ho, hos, and hosos; such or what sort of; especially the neuter with negative, not so.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
20.str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
20.str2: Probably akin to ho, hos, and hosos; such or what sort of; especially the neuter with negative, not so.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
Contention, strife, wrangling. Of uncertain affinity; a quarrel, i.e. wrangling.
From zeo; properly, heat, i.e. 'zeal' (figuratively, of God), or an enemy, malice).
An outburst of passion, wrath. From thuo; passion.
Perhaps as the same as erethizo; properly, intrigue, i.e. faction.
Evil-speaking, backbiting, detraction, slander. From katalalos; defamation.
A whispering, secret slandering. From a derivative of psithos; whispering, i.e. Secret detraction.
A puffing up, pride, swelling. From phusioo; inflation, i.e. haughtiness.
From akatastatos; instability, i.e. Disorder.

21.str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
21.str2: To come, go.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
21.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: To make or bring low, humble, humiliate; pass: To be humbled. From tapeinos; to depress; figuratively, to humiliate.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
21.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
21.str2: To mourn, lament, feel guilt. From penthos; to grieve.
Much, many; often.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

21.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
21.str2: To sin previously. From pro and hamartano; to sin previously.
And, even, also, namely.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
21.str2: From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
Uncleanness, impurity. From akathartos; impurity, physically or morally.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.
And, even, also, namely.
From a compound of a and a presumed selges; licentiousness.
